---
title: isBrowser
---

The `isBrowser` function determines whether the current JavaScript runtime is running in a browser environment.

### Import

```ts
import { isBrowser } from "@tai-kun/surrealdb/utils";
```

### Usage

```ts
function isBrowser(): boolean;
```

#### Arguments

None.

#### Return Value

Returns `true` if the environment is a browser, and `false` otherwise.

#### Example

The following example demonstrates how to determine if the environment is a browser:

```ts
import { isBrowser } from "@tai-kun/surrealdb/utils";

if (isBrowser()) {
  document;
}
```

### Explanation

The function checks if the global variable `document` is `undefined`. If it is not, the environment is considered a browser. For example, in Deno, the `window` object is added globally, so checking for its existence would incorrectly identify a server runtime as a browser. The Web framework Remix calls this [Document Guard](https://remix.run/docs/en/main/guides/constraints#document-guard).
